gaming
Almost as good as Half Life: 3

incredible game with some fucking insane achievements. some of them (pedal to the metal, neighbourhood watch) are really fun (although neighbourhood watch is very tough even if you know what you're doing), and some of them (get some grub, little rocket man) are insanely annoying and tedious. thankfully, there are sections where you can leave the gnome behind, but the chapter riding shotgun is absolute hell, and it was by far my least favourite chapter to do with the gnome, despite being a favourite on a normal playthrough (i went through it with the gnome on normal difficulty, but i'm told that the chopper is less frustrating on easy). my favourite part of the game is definitely the antlion caves and hive. that environment is just so well realized and the setting complements the source engine's strengths. it is definitely the most hl1 thing valve has done since hl1.

in summary: play this one [strike] to get to episode 3 [/strike] before playing alyx (if you can afford to lol), but do not go for the achievements on your first playthrough. it will probably ruin parts of the game for you.

note: the game is a bit buggy on intel hd, starting with some strange textures in riding shotgun and continuing into some occasional rendering freezes and weird model glitches (like the gnome becoming splintered and see-through). the final map of the game is particularily buggy but restarts fix it.
Honestly its the best story telling game I've ever played, 10/10 dentists recommend it.

Blue-balling.

Y asi, llegamos a lo que es, el ultimo juego de Half Life, en su momento antes de la salida de HL: Alyx.
Una vez escapado de Ciudad 17, nos dirigimos a White FRorest, para poner fin de una vez a todas a todo.
Aun al dia de hoy este sigue siendo un gran juego, divertido, con la misma variedad de armas, y un nuevo vehiculo.
Sin duda, la saga de Half Life es una que no debes pasar por alto, ya que te encantara, y te uniras a una gran comunidad de jugadores, que esperan con ansias, la sagrada y deseada, 3ra entrega...

"We should thank our benefactors for giving us respite from this overpowering force. They have thrown a switch and exorcised our demons in a single stroke. They have given us the strength we never could have summoned to overcome this compulsion. They have given us purpose. They have turned our eyes toward the stars."
â€• Wallace Breen, addressing citizens' concerns about the Combine negating human reproduction.[src]
 
The Combine, abbreviated as CMB, and referred to in propaganda as "Our Benefactors"[2], is an immense inter-dimensional empire, comprised of a number of species either as allies or as slaves. The Combine's ultimate goal is to enslave and control the Multiverse.[3]

Following the Black Mesa Incident, and the death of the Nihilanth, the Combine invaded Earth and emerged victorious from the ensuing war against the humans in a mere seven hours. Nevertheless, humanity did not remain subjugated, and nearly twenty years later, Earth's Resistance culminated in The Uprising, and the Combine were beaten thrice in pivotal battles.

These events were spearheaded by Gordon Freeman, having been released by The G-Man from stasis. The Combine serves as the overarching antagonistic force of the overall Half-life series and is the main antagonistic force of Half-Life 2, its episodes, and Half-Life: Alyx.

Yes

I bought the Half-Life games bundle to revisit the series after the years. While HL1 is a good game with some flaws and HL2 has more flaws, but is still decent, in additional HL2 episodes everything just falls apart. Ep2 is basically series of minigames based on fighting many waves of enemies with the old tricks of series pushed to an extraordinary obnoxious level. Story is just ridiculous, but some children may appreciate, that player-Gordon is constantly praised for his great achievements (to the point that it is laugable as well for an adult player). On the plus side is some nice nature scenery (a player in Ep2 does not constantly look at the typical HL hallmark concrete, although it is still present in abundance) and slightly improved graphics in comparison to HL2. It unfortunately also means even longer loading delays (another hallmark of series), that are still present on modern gaming computers, but graphics is obviously dated today. The game for ardent fans of the series only.

Good game but short story

Slightly longer than the first episode DLC, the second episode reintroduces a vehicle for you to use and some fun defensive set-pieces. Otherwise it's more of the same you'd expect from Half-Life.

Only problem with this game is that Valve leaves the story hanging and they haven't picked it up again for over a decade. Everyone's waiting for Half Life 3, but I have to say that the developers have probably run out of gameplay ideas, and what new ideas they had they poured into the Portal games.

I say that because when you play enough half-life, the gameplay elements start to become somewhat repetitive and easy to figure out. They'll have to come up with something fresh for HL3 to push the technology if they don't go ahead and make a VR-only game.

Nostalgia pura, re jugado y con mas ganas que salga el 3 :c

Half Life 2: Episode Two will give the player a great experience, just like the rest of the half life series. The gameplay and graphics are about the same as previous Half Life 2 games (the flash-light is no longer tied to your general power, which is a great change). 

The sad part is that the story is left unfinished after this game. Where the game ends with a cliffhanger, Half Life 2: Episode 3 would never see the light of day. At the time of writing, we did get a new prequel (Half Life Alyx), I hope Valve will evantually finish the series one way or another. 

The entire Half Life series is an absolute masterpiece, even with an unfinished ending. I fully recommend the experience to any fan of single player games.

Best Half-Life Game
Its a really good game and I play it all the time. Yes its a little outdated for its time but you'll have a really fun experience with this one. I recommend this all the way.

I loved it. I really appreciated the change of scenery compared of HL2 et ep. 1

In term of pacing, episode 2 is my favorite. I thought that levels in Hl2 were too long.
The story is good too. It picks up right after episode 1 and develops the plot a little bit.
